newsitem.title: HUNGARY: MOL ends lower on delayed energy price rise.
newsitem.headline: MOL ends lower on delayed energy price rise.

text.p: Hungarian share prices closed mixed on the Budapest Stock Exchange on Friday when oil company MOL was a heavy loser after the government's Thursday announcement that it will postpone the energy price increase until January 1, 1997 from October 1.

"The overall athmosphere was downcast but this is really only valid for MOL and (chemical company) TVK as all other shares were mostly stagnant or firmer," said Kalman Schuszter of New York Broker Budapest.
The BUX ended at 3,357.09 points, down 13.14. BUX index futures dropped for all maturities, by 38.00 to 86.00 points.

"MOL's fall was evidently the result of the delay in energy price increase," Schuszter said, adding its fall was expected after its decline on London's SEAQ. MOL slid to a daily low of 1,540 forints but layter rebounded to end at 1,595, down 165.
TVK closed at 1,330 forints, down 20, in what traders said was a continuous supply of foreign investors.

Hotelier Danubius soared to a daily peak of 2,850 forints but later retreated to end at 2,720 forints, up 130, after it a suspension on Thursday, prior to the privatisation agency's announcement that Danubius won the tender for Hungaria Szalloda Rt.
